Dear Mr. Yohe,
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
05/01/2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that incident
reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents named under
the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of CAPS. The agency was informed that starting January 1, 2024,
interim and renewal audit CAP's will be reviewed with the agency at three months
and six months. The assigned Consultant for the agency will work with the
agency in conducting CAP reviews. This process for special investigation CAP
reviews was implemented previously in 2022.
• Rule 12326 Borrowed Home. Recommended that the agency develop a specific
sign off document for foster parents to sign when accepting a child into their
home.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows. The agency
submitted an approved corrective action plan on April 23, 2023, in response to rule
violations established for sending late renewal applications and signatures for
treatment plans obtained late. during the April 13, 2023, renewal audit. The current
interim audit did not establish any rule violations indicating the agency CAP was
successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was thorough and well written. The
assessment addressed the agency CAP and compliance with rules and policy
during the licensing year. The assessment noted systemic barriers included dental
providers who are not common in rural areas and do not take foster care dental
plans. Another noted barrier is the difficulty in locating absent parents or parents
living out of state. The assessment detailed where the agency is meeting rule and
policy requirements.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and therefore financial records were not
available.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported liking working for the agency and they feel they are part
of a supportive, high functioning team. Staff further reported they feel they are
supported by their supervisors and that the supervisors are knowledgeable.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern facility in Bessemer MI. The building has
adequate office space and is well maintained. CHRI documents were found to be
secured appropriately.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not establish any safety alerts during her visits to the homes.
The CPA Analyst reported that foster parents and relatives felt supported by the
agency and services are comprehensive.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
May 13, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
